title: WCAS PSYCH 470-0-20 Topics in Brain, Behavior, and Cognition

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will human memory function from the perspective of basic cognitive processes and their basis in cognitive neuroscience. Each week, selected readings will focus on a major area or question in memory research. Memory phenomena will be organized according to a general framework of memory systems within the brain. Topic will include memory storage and retrieval, familiarity, meta-memory, amnesia, nondeclarative memory, priming, category leaning, and sequence learning.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Prerequisite: Graduate Students (Undergraduates with permission of instructor)

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Grades will be based on discussions, in-class presentations and a review paper.
